description: Breaking the Silence, an Israeli organization of military veterans working to raise awareness of Israel’s abuses in the occupied Palestinian territory, said Israeli forces do not need “direct orders” to “dehumanize” Palestinian people.
title: Israeli troops feel ‘entitled’ to abuse Palestinian civilians, says military veterans

description: Mohammed al-Moghayyar, director of the civil defence’s supply department in Gaza, says Israeli forces continue to deliberately target their teams across the strip to prevent them from providing humanitarian assistance.
title: Israeli forces prevented civil defense from responding to 23 emergency calls

description: Tamer Qarmout, a professor at the Doha Institute of Graduate Studies, says the US presidential debate highlights how both Democrats and Republicans have lost their will to end Israel’s war on Gaza and to support the creation of a Palestinian state.
title: No vision to end Gaza conflict for both Democrats and Republicans: professor

description: Far-right Israeli politicians are celebrating Finance Minister Bezalel Smotrich’s claim that Israel’s security cabinet has approved his proposed legalization of five illegal “outposts” on Palestinian land in the occupied West Bank.
title: Far-right Israelis celebrate claim that illegal outposts will be legalized

description: The reality of the 2024 presidential contest is setting in now that the first debate of the election cycle showcased the two main options voters have in November.
title: Biden’s poor performance and Trump’s lies: four key takeaways from the debate

description: TEHRAN - Election fever filled the air in cities and villages across Iran on Friday as citizens headed to polls in snap presidential elections while still mourning the sudden passing of President Ebrahim Raisi in a helicopter crash.
title: Iranians head to polls unfazed by enemy propaganda

description: The Israeli Occupation Forces (IOF) have launched a fresh ground and air assault on Shejaiya and its surrounding areas in the northern Gaza Strip, where residents have spoken of heavy bombardment.
title: Shejaiya, a signal of Israeli failure

description: TEHRAN - While Israel has been massacring Gazans for more than 260 days with the backing of “genocide Joe”, Donald Trump is not still satisfied and called Joe Biden a “bad Palestinian” in the first presidential debate on Thursday.
title: Trump not satisfied with the magnitude of Gaza carnage

description: TEHRAN – Hezbollah Secretary General Sayyed Hassan Nasrallah emphasized Iran’s significant role in shaping the region's future while addressing a ceremony in Tehran marking the 40th day since President Ebrahim Raisi's passing in a helicopter crash.
title: What goes on in Iran determines fate of other countries: Hezbollah Chief

description: TEHRAN – Early Friday, the Saudi Arabian Ministry of Foreign Affairs announced a significant phone consultation between Iran's acting Foreign Minister, Ali Baqeri Kani, and Saudi Arabia's Foreign Minister, Faisal bin Farhan.
title: Iran, Saudi Arabia discuss bilateral relations, regional issues

description: Iran’s ambassador to the United Nations on Thursday strongly rejected allegations by the IAEA Board of Governors against the Islamic Republic for its peaceful nuclear program.
title: Iran writes to UN, dismisses E3-crafted IAEA resolution

description: TEHRAN - Iran's Ambassador to the United Nations, Amir Saeed Iravani, has condemned Canada's designation of the Islamic Revolution Guards Corps (IRGC) as a "terrorist group" as "unlawful," "dangerous," and "politically motivated."
title: ‘Unlawful’ and ‘politically motivated’: Iran denounces Canada's blacklisting of IRGC

description: TEHRAN – Iranians around the world participated in the snap presidential election on Friday, casting their ballots at over 344 polling stations set up for overseas voters.
title: Over 340 polling stations receive ballots from Iranians outside the country

description: TEHRAN - In a note, Kayhan addressed the efforts of the foreign enemy media to boycott the elections and said: The boycotters of the elections, in addition to various people, include a diverse range of opponents of the Islamic Republic.
title: The failed opposition seeks to boycott the elections

description: TEHRAN – Iran has firmly rejected recent statements made by a U.S. administration official concerning the country's presidential election, labeling the remarks as "worthless" and "meddlesome."
title: Iran condemns ‘meddlesome’ U.S. claims about presidential election

description: TEHRAN – Hours after voting began in Iran's snap presidential election on Friday, Leader of the Islamic Revolution Ayatollah Seyyed Ali Khamenei cast his ballot in Tehran in front of dozens of reporters and offered a final message to the Iranian people.
title: Leader asks Iranians to make ‘best and most useful choice’

description: TEHRAN – Russian President Vladimir Putin and acting Iranian President Mohammad Mokhber engaged in a telephone conversation to discuss enhancing bilateral energy cooperation and advancing large-scale infrastructure projects.
title: Putin, Iran acting president discuss bilateral cooperation in key sectors

description: TEHRAN- In a note published on the FDD website on June 22, 2024, Behnam Ben Taleblu and Janatan Sayeh wrote that " Iran’s Presidential Election Seeks to Consolidate Regime’s Control". This note presents a good opportunity to have an overview of holding elections in Iran while answering the claims of the authors.
title: Debunking FDD waffle on Iran’s elections

description: TEHRAN- The people of Iran went to the polls on Friday (June 28)  to elect the president of the fourteenth government. Iran's enemies claim that elections in Iran are not free. To investigate this claim, it is worth taking a look at the history of elections in Iran.
title: Elections in Iran’s history: from show to competition

description: TEHRAN- “The Lieutenant of Inishmore,” a black comedy play written by the British-Irish playwright Martin McDonagh will go on stage at Tehran’s Shahrzad Theater Complex on Saturday evening.
title: “The Lieutenant of Inishmore” to go on stage in Tehran theater

description:
* A collection of paintings by Serminaz Barseghian is on view in an exhibition at O Gallery.
The exhibit titled “Forgetfulness: Running” will continue until July 9 at the gallery, which can be found at 8 Shahin St., Sanai St.
title: What’s in Tehran art galleries

description: TEHRAN-Two short films from Iran are participating in the 25th ShorTS International Film Festival, launched in Trieste, Italy, on June 28.
title: Italy’s ShorTS International Film Festival hosting 2 Iranian movies

description: TEHRAN-The House of Humanities Thinkers in Tehran will host a commemoration ceremony for the great Persian Poet of the 17th century Saeb Tabrizi on Monday.
title: Saeb Tabrizi to be commemorated in Tehran

description: TEHRAN-The first Annual International Watercolor of Iran, showcasing 200 artworks from 24 countries, has been launched at two sites in Tehran.
title: Artworks from 24 countries on display at first Annual International Watercolor of Iran

description: TEHRAN - Women from Iran turning heads at the FIBA U18 Women's Asia Cup as they eye-off a promotion to Division A.
title: Iran U18 women basketball’s focus is promotion to Division A: FIBA

description: BEIJING- Chinese capital Beijing holds a conference marking the 70th anniversary of the country’s Five Principles of Peaceful Coexistence on Friday.
title: China’s 70th anniversary of Five Principles of Peaceful Coexistence celebrated

description: TEHRAN – The number of visits to Teppeh Hasanlu, an archaeological hill that dates some 8,000 years, has been doubled to 3,200 people in the first quarter of this Persian year (started on March 20) compared to the same period a year earlier, according to a local official.
title: Visits to millennia-old Hasanlu jumps twofold in Q1

description: TEHRAN – Some restoration projects, aimed at breathing new lives into five Asbads (ancient vertical windmills) within Khaf region have been started.
title: Centuries-old windmills undergo renovation

description: TEHRAN – A book titled “Comprehensive Encyclopedia of Iran's Caves,” authored by Changiz Sheikhali who is a veteran speleologist, has recently been unveiled in Tehran.
title: Encyclopedia of Iran’s caves unveiled

description: TEHRAN – In an effort to extend its tourism market, Isfahan played hostess to a group of Russian travel insiders on Wednesday.
title: Isfahan to receive Russian tourists with open arms

description: TEHRAN - Qasemabad, an old village in northern Iran, is a vibrant gem recognized globally as the World Village of Chador-Shab Weaving by the World Handicrafts Council.
title: From tradition to global recognition: discover Qasemabad textiles

description: TEHRAN – The upper deck of the historical Si-o-Se Pol bridge, an architectural gem in Isfahan, has undergone comprehensive restoration for the first time in a decade.
title: Iconic Si-o-Se Pol undergoes restoration

description: Russian Minister of Economic Development Maxim Reshetnikov spoke during the plenary session "Prospects for BRICS tourism co-operation in new conditions" at the BRICS Tourism Forum in Moscow. This is the first thematic forum of the international association, which brought together more than 300 leading experts, business and government representatives of the BRICS countries.
title: Russian minister: 60% of visas issued in Russia are for BRICS citizens

description: TEHRAN – An Iranian trade delegation comprised of creative and knowledge-based industries ecosystem is attending Iran-Uzbekistan creative industries week which is being held in Tashkent from June 26 to 30.
title: Tashkent hosting Iran-Uzbekistan creative industries week

description: Oxford Word Skills books are a collection of English vocabulary learning resources for all levels. This collection focuses on active and practical learning of new words in various fields of daily life and education.
title: Oxford word skills (Elementary, Intermediate, Advanced)

description: TEHRAN – With studies suggesting that half the world’s population will call the tropics home by 2050, it’s more important than ever to protect these unique and fragile ecosystems.
title: Protecting tropical ecosystem ‘more important than ever’

description: TEHRAN – A total of 1,070 people benefited from rescue services of the Iranian Red Crescent Society (IRCS) in 12 provinces of the country from June 21 to 27.
title: IRCS provides rescue services to 12 flood-hit provinces

description: TEHRAN –Studies show that the average temperature in Iran in the last decade is about two degrees Celsius higher than the average of the past five decades, indicating that the change in temperature has been upward in the country.
title: Average temperature rise by 2 degrees over 5 decades

description: TEHRAN –Studies show that the average temperature in Iran in the last decade is about two degrees Celsius higher than the average of the past five decades, indicating that the change in temperature has been upward in the country.
title: Average temperature rises by 2 degrees over 5 decades

description: Various types of soda, sodium methylate, sodium sulfate and other chemicals are widely used in the industry due to their properties. Caustic soda is a very strong base that has a high power in breaking down fat; For this reason, in case of contact ...
title: What is liquid interest? The difference between liquid interest and perk interest

description: XINJIANG- A number of journalists from some Asian, European, and African countries paid a one-week visit to Xinjiang province, in the northwest of China.
title: Xinjiang rich in nature, culture in eyes of foreign journalists

description: TEHRAN - The Islamic Republic of Iran ranks fourth in West Asia in attracting Foreign Direct Investment (FDI) after the United Arab Emirates, Saudi Arabia and Turkey, an official said.
title: Iran ranks 4th in attracting FDI in West Asia

description: XINJIANG- Xinjiang province, located in the northwest of China, is a land of diverse cultures and rich cuisine traditions.
title: Samsa, delicious dumpling in Xinjiang

description: TEHRAN - Iran’s exports of non-oil commodities have increased by 40 percent during three years to March 2024, according to the Islamic Republic of Iran Customs Administration (IRICA).
title: Iran’s non-oil exports rise 40% in 3 years to March

description: XINJIANG- Some journalists from Asia, Africa, and Europe visited a cotton farm in Awat County, Aksu Prefecture, Xinjiang province, in the northwest of China.
title: Foreign journalists visit cotton farm in Xinjiang

description: TEHRAN - The Islamic Development Bank (IsDB) is offering Iran a credit line worth €700 million following the negotiations made and reimbursement of arrears of the Iranian government at the bank.
title: IsDB to offer €700 million credit to Iran

description: XINJIANG- Urumqi, the capital of China’s northwestern Xinjiang province, is hosting 8th China-Eurasia Expo.
title: Xinjiang’s capital hosting 8th China-Eurasia Expo

description: TEHRAN - A memorandum of understanding (MOU) was signed between Tehran and Moscow for the transfer of Russian gas to Iran on Thursday, Shana reported.
title: Iran, Russia sign MOU on energy cooperation

description: TEHRAN – Iran will kick off the 2024 CAFA U20 Championship with a match against Turkmenistan on July 7.
title: Iran to play Turkmenistan at 2024 CAFA U20 Championship opener

description: TEHRAN - The presidential elections began in Iran at 8 a.m. local time (0430 GMT) on Friday.
title: Presidential elections underway in Iran
